Protocol on Scientific Cooperation Signed 
    Moscow, June 18 (KCNA) -- A protocol on 2005-2007 scientific cooperation between the DPRK Academy of Sciences and the Russian Academy of Sciences was signed in Moscow on June 18.
 Present at the signing ceremony were a DPRK delegation of the Academy of Sciences headed by Pyon Yong Rip who is president of the Academy, Russian Academy of Sciences President Yuri Ossipov and leading officials of the Academy, DPRK Ambassador E. P. to the Russian Federation Pak Ui Chun and staff members of the embassy.    
  The protocol was signed by Pyon Yong Rip and Yuri Ossipov.

articles.content:
Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il from Military Attaches Corps 
    Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a congratulatory letter from the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of his start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 Abdullah Hamidi Benam, military attache of the Iranian embassy here who is doyen of the military attaches corps, conveyed the letter to Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Il Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, on June 18.

DPRK Government Trade Delegation Leaves for Malaysia and Thailand
    Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government trade delegation led by Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade, left here Saturday to visit Malaysia and Thailand.
 The delegation was seen off at the airport by Ri Ryong Nam, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, officials concerned and Zahari Ghazali, Malaysian charge d' affaires ad interim in Pyongyang.
